Class GameData

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameData

  • public class GameData
extends Object
    Represents a card game of war.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The player’s hand.

      static int WAR_CRDS
      The number of cards dealt during a war battle.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameData()
      Starts a simulated game, shuffling a full deck and distributing the cards to the player and computer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameData

        public GameData()
        Starts a simulated game, shuffling a full deck and distributing the cards to the player and computer.

    • Method Detail

      • next

        public void next()
        Makes a turn happen: either starts a battl. Plays a battle. The player and the computer put down two cards. Whoever’s card is higher wins.

      • battle

        private void battle(int numCards)
        Makes both the player and the computer each deal the specified number of cards and then calculates the winner of the battle.
        Parameters:
        numCards - the number of cards the player and the computer will each deal

      • endWar

        private void endWar()
        Returns the cards in the piles back to the hand of player who won the last battle.

      • getGameWinner

        public int getGameWinner()
        Returns the winner of the game.
        Returns:
        The winner of the game as an interger (1 (player), 2 (computer), or 0 (unfinished game).

      • getBtlWinner

        public int getBtlWinner()
        Returns the winner of the last battle.
        Returns:
        The winner of the last battle as an interger (1 (player), 2 (computer), or 0 (there was no winner).

      • getPlayPileTop

        public Card getPlayPileTop()
        Returns the player’s last played card.
        Returns:
        The card at the top of the player’s pile.

      • getCompPileTop

        public Card getCompPileTop()
        Returns the computer’s last played card.
        Returns:
        The card at the top of the computer’s pile.

      • playHandSize

        public int playHandSize()
        Returns the number of cards in the player’s hand.
        Returns:
        The number of cards in the player’s hand.

        Returns the number of cards in the computer’s hand.
